name: Data Structures and Algorithms
description: Key concepts in organizing and processing data.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a linear data structure?

Which of the following is a graph traversal technique?

answers: Left child is less than parent
Right child is greater than parent

answers: A stack is LIFO, and a queue is FIFO
A stack is FIFO, and a queue is LIFO
A stack is ordered, and a queue is unordered
questions.correctAnswer: A stack is LIFO, and a queue is FIFO

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of an IP address in a computer network?
answers: To identify a device on the network

name: Operating Systems
description: Learn how operating systems function and manage hardware resources.

questions.questionText: Which of these is a type of operating system?
Which component manages memory in an operating system?
Which OS uses the kernel for process management?
What is the main function of an operating system?
Which of the following is responsible for process scheduling in an OS?
Which part of the operating system is responsible for managing file systems?
What is virtual memory used for?
answers: Creating an illusion of a larger main memory
questions.correctAnswer: Creating an illusion of a larger main memory

questions.questionText: Which of these is a type of system call?
What is a deadlock in an operating system?
answers: A situation where two or more processes are waiting indefinitely for a resource
A process that is running indefinitely
questions.correctAnswer: A situation where two or more processes are waiting indefinitely for a resource

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of a file system?
answers: Organize data into files and directories
questions.correctAnswer: Organize data into files and directories

questions.questionText: Which scheduling algorithm is most commonly used in operating systems?
What is the function of the 'init' process in Linux?
Which of these is an example of a process synchronization tool?
What is a kernel in an operating system?
answers: The core component of the OS
questions.correctAnswer: The core component of the OS

questions.questionText: Which of the following is used for inter-process communication?
What is a process control block (PCB)?
answers: A data structure storing process information
questions.correctAnswer: A data structure storing process information

questions.questionText: What is multitasking in an operating system?
answers: Running multiple instances of the same program
Executing a program in the background

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a memory management technique?
Which of these is an example of a time-sharing operating system?
What does the acronym 'OS' stand for?

name: Operating Systems
description: Learn how operating systems function and manage hardware resources.

questions.questionText: Which of these is a type of operating system?
Which component manages memory in an operating system?
Which OS uses the kernel for process management?
Which of the following is a key function of an operating system?
What does the term 'multitasking' refer to in an operating system?
Which component of an operating system directly interacts with hardware?
What is the primary purpose of a file system in an operating system?
answers: To organize and store files on a storage device
questions.correctAnswer: To organize and store files on a storage device

questions.questionText: Which of the following is not a common operating system?
Which of the following is a feature of a real-time operating system?
What does the term 'virtual memory' refer to?
answers: Memory management that allows programs to use more memory than physically available
Memory reserved for the operating system
A type of memory that stores virtual data
Memory used for virtual machine operations
questions.correctAnswer: Memory management that allows programs to use more memory than physically available

questions.questionText: Which of the following is responsible for managing processes in an operating system?
What is the role of an operating system kernel?
answers: To provide a graphical user interface
To manage hardware and software resources
questions.correctAnswer: To manage hardware and software resources

questions.questionText: Which operating system uses a graphical user interface (GUI) as its primary interface?
Which type of operating system is most commonly used in embedded systems?
Which of the following is true about open-source operating systems?
answers: Their source code is freely available
They are slower than proprietary operating systems
questions.correctAnswer: Their source code is freely available

questions.questionText: What is the role of the shell in an operating system?

name: Web Development

questions.questionText: Which HTML tag is used to create a link?

answers: To add interactivity to the webpage
questions.correctAnswer: To add interactivity to the webpage

questions.questionText: Which CSS property is used to control the layout of a webpage?
What is the purpose of the <form> tag in HTML?

answers: Both Media Queries and CSS Grid
questions.correctAnswer: Both Media Queries and CSS Grid

questions.questionText: What does CSS stand for?
Which tool is commonly used for version control in web development?

answers: To contain content that is visible on the page
To include metadata and links to external resources
To display the main content of the page
questions.correctAnswer: To include metadata and links to external resources

name: Software Engineering
description: Learn principles and practices for building software systems.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a software development methodology?

Which of these is an example of an object-oriented programming language?

answers: To check the overall system performance
To test individual components or functions
questions.correctAnswer: To test individual components or functions

questions.questionText: What is an example of a continuous integration tool?
Which of these is an agile framework?
What is the purpose of the Design Pattern in software engineering?
answers: To create reusable solutions to common problems
questions.correctAnswer: To create reusable solutions to common problems

questions.questionText: What is the role of a software architect?
answers: To define the software system's structure and design
questions.correctAnswer: To define the software system's structure and design

questions.questionText: What is version control?
answers: Tracking changes to source code over time
A process to deploy code into production
questions.correctAnswer: Tracking changes to source code over time

questions.questionText: Which of these is a commonly used software engineering principle?
What does the term 'refactoring' mean in software development?
answers: Improving code quality without changing its behavior
questions.correctAnswer: Improving code quality without changing its behavior

name: Cybersecurity
description: Understand methods for protecting systems, networks, and data.

questions.questionText: What does VPN stand for?
Which is a type of malware?
What is the purpose of encryption?
What is two-factor authentication?
answers: A security measure requiring two forms of identification
questions.correctAnswer: A security measure requiring two forms of identification

questions.questionText: Which of these is a common type of phishing attack?
Which protocol is commonly used for secure communication over the internet?
What is a firewall used for?
Which is an example of a brute force attack?
answers: Guessing passwords by trying all possible combinations
questions.correctAnswer: Guessing passwords by trying all possible combinations

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of multi-factor authentication?
answers: To require multiple forms of verification
questions.correctAnswer: To require multiple forms of verification

questions.questionText: Which type of attack involves intercepting and altering communication between two parties?
Which of these is a popular antivirus software?
What is the principle of least privilege?
answers: Granting users the minimum access required to perform their tasks
Sharing private keys with trusted parties
questions.correctAnswer: Granting users the minimum access required to perform their tasks

name: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
description: Dive into AI and ML concepts, algorithms, and their applications.

questions.questionText: Which algorithm is used for supervised learning?
What is deep learning?
Which library is used for machine learning in Python?
Which of the following is a type of neural network architecture?
What is the purpose of activation functions in neural networks?
Which of the following is an example of an unsupervised learning algorithm?
What is overfitting in machine learning?
answers: When the model performs well on training data but poorly on new data
When the model is too simple
When the model has high bias
When the model is too complex
questions.correctAnswer: When the model performs well on training data but poorly on new data

questions.questionText: Which of these is a key concept in reinforcement learning?
Which Python library is commonly used for data manipulation and analysis in ML?
What does the term 'epochs' refer to in machine learning?
answers: The number of times the model is trained on the entire dataset
The time it takes for the model to train
The number of layers in a neural network
questions.correctAnswer: The number of times the model is trained on the entire dataset

questions.questionText: Which type of machine learning is used when the output is a continuous value?
